Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; exterior, white slip: tongue pattern below junction of neck and shoulder; below, painted decoration consisting of hare (part of hind and forelegs missing) with added red blobs on body, to right; at right, part of tendril from floral motif; dot rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the subject matter, see British Museum 1888, 0208.49 from Tell Dafana.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (p. 14, no. 26163, pl. III, no. 26163)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.008)
